name: juniperus-chinensis-kaizuka
particularly-resistant-to-insects/diseas: Deer, salt, air pollution, erosion, drought
light: Full sun (6 or more hours of direct sunlight a day)
fruit-description: No true fruits, but female cones are blue, fleshy "berry" looking and edible, often used as a seasoning.
flower-description:
No flowers, but cones are large and brown 
and fall apart upon maturity.  Female cones are blue, fleshy "berry" looking.
leaf-description: 90% or more of leaves on this plant are scale leaves in 4 ranks. Leaves are in opposite pairs, are tufted, and are a vivid bluish-green in color. The variegated form has creamy, white markings. Juvenile leaves are awl shaped.
stem-description: Stems are twisted with irregular open areas, making the plant "a living piece of sculpture."
